image.altText: Donald Trump getting out of his presidential car

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says an intelligence leak is "fake news", after it cast doubt on his claim US air strikes "obliterated" Iranian nuclear sites. Follow live.

title.children: Trump's secretary of state says Iran 'much further away from nuclear weapon'

image.altText: A satellite image of the Fordow nuclear site.

props.synopsis: US media reports say leaked intelligence has cast doubt on US President Donald Trump's assertion that Iran's nuclear facilities have been "obliterated".

title.children: US strikes only set back Iran's nuclear program by a few months, leaked intelligence says

image.altText: Two Aboriginal women sit below a tree wearing shirts with the faces Cindy and Mona

props.synopsis: After decades of advocacy from her family, 'Cindy's Law' closes a loophole that allowed a young woman's perpetrator to walk free.

title.children: Their daughters died and a man walked free. Today they saw some justice

image.altText: Australian currency is seen next to a wages graph

props.synopsis: Consumer prices rose 2.1 per cent over the year to May, down from 2.4 per cent the previous month, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

title.children: Inflation eases back more than expected in May

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Justice Christopher Beale's directions to the jury in Ms Patterson's triple-murder trial enter their second day at the Latrobe Valley Law Courts in the regional Victorian town of Morwell.

title.children: Judge in Erin Patterson trial continues final instructions to jury

image.altText: A woman stands at a podium with multiple microphones, and a Palestinian flag behind her. She wears a black suit.

props.synopsis: Hugh Marks says the ABC regrets "how the decision to remove Ms Lattouf from air was handled", after the Federal Court found her employment was terminated in part to "appease pro-Israel lobbyists"

title.children: ABC chief says Lattouf case was not 'a good use of taxpayers' money'

image.altText: Ley walks through crowd, Anne Ruston walks behind her.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley opens a major address with an acknowledgement of country and speaks of her "respect" for public servants, marking a subtle shift in tone from a Coalition election campaign that saw the Liberals nearly wiped out of Australia's major cities.

title.children: Sussan Ley's press club address marks tone shift for Liberals

image.altText: A man, smiling, wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: A jury finds a man who stabbed a young Melbourne doctor 11 times after a home invasion guilty of murder.

title.children: Jury finds man guilty of murdering doctor Ashley Gordon

image.altText: A man in a suit with a red tie smiling and waving.

props.synopsis: Former New York governor Andrew Cuomo on Tuesday conceded to Zohran Mamdani in the Democratic primary election for New York City mayor, setting up the 33-year-old to win the party's nomination in the heavily Democratic city.

title.children: Andrew Cuomo concedes New York City Democratic mayoral contest

image.altText: A smiling woman wearing a yellow top stands in front of a field of yellow flowers

props.synopsis: A woman found not guilty by mental incompetence of stabbing her children has requested she be allowed supervised trips outside of a mental health facility.

title.children: Mother who stabbed two sons seeks release from mental health facility as fathers recall trauma

image.altText: A woman in yellow jumper holding shopping bag faces a supermarket shelf full of colourful wrapped foods.

props.synopsis: Aldi has the best price for a basket of 14 regularly priced items, followed by Woolworths, Coles and IGA.

title.children: Where to buy the cheapest groceries, according to latest Choice survey

image.altText: A man wearing a scrubs shirt and glasses looking sombre with framed certificates in the background

props.synopsis: A Queensland GP is calling for urgent action after his patient waited for several days in the emergency department and says he had to be sedated, a claim hospital bosses dispute.

title.children: Mental health patient 'sedated' and waiting for days in emergency department

image.altText: A Localcoin branded Bitcoin ATM.

props.synopsis: More than 90 people were swept up in the multi-police-agency crackdown, with 21 of those believed to be either victims or offenders of romance and investment scams.

title.children: Widow scammed out of 'life savings' caught up in crypto ATM sting

image.altText: A man and a woman inside a camper van.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have announced a new $500,000 reward for information that leads to the discovery of Peter Falconio's body, more than 20 years after his murder.

title.children: Police offer $500k reward in bid to find Peter Falconio's remains

image.altText: Rachel Zegler as Snow White in a forest holding her hand out for a firefly to land on.

props.synopsis: Actor Rachel Zegler says therapy and medication helped her deal with the backlash she endured over this year's live-action adaptation of Snow White, which flopped at the box office amid controversy and negative reviews.

title.children: Rachel Zegler opens up about impact of Snow White backlash

image.altText: Black and white image of five soldiers in a trench looking at the camera

props.synopsis: When veterans returned to Australia after the Korean War, they were shunned. Seventy-five years after the conflict started, they're finally getting their moment.

title.children: John served Australia, but his local RSL said 'no'

image.altText: A plane being blown adrift at Sydney Airport.

props.synopsis: Winds in excess of 100kph have delayed flights in Sydney, blown roofs off buildings in Wollongong and left some 12,300 homes and businesses on the state's south coast without power.

title.children: Flights delayed, trees down as 100kph winds roar through parts of NSW

image.altText: Jennifer and Gretl Petelczyc who were shot dead in their own home by Mark James Bombara.

props.synopsis: WA's corruption watchdog is investigating how a man who killed two women in Floreat was able to legally own firearms.

title.children: Corruption watchdog probes how Floreat murderer legally owned firearms

image.altText: Side profile of Guy Barnett and Jeremy Rockliff.

props.synopsis: The blame game begins after Tasmania's Treasury finds the 2028 state debt will be $3 billion worse than predicted in the May state budget.

title.children: Tasmanian debt to be $3 billion worse than Liberal projection, Treasury finds

image.altText: Untitled Photo - 2025-06-25 09:50:21

props.synopsis: The head of the state agency which controls the lives of people deemed incapable of making their own decisions concedes the system is being used against vulnerable people.

title.children: WA public advocate admits guardianship system is being misused

image.altText: Caitlin Clark lifts her hands up in celebration

props.synopsis: Caitlin Clark's impact on women's basketball is being felt in Australia and beyond, with the sport's popularity soaring.

title.children: Superstar's arrival puts women's basketball on cusp of Matildas moment

image.altText: Composite image of Gout Gout and Usain Bolt running.

props.synopsis: Gout Gout's star is rising even faster than his legs can carry him, and with a world championships debut on the horizon, managing expectations is going to be difficult.

title.children: If Gout struggles at the world championships, he's only as bad as Bolt

image.altText: The exterior of a building with NDIS signage prominently displayed on the outside. Location is not specific.

props.synopsis: There are changes afoot in WA on how the NDIS operates. What is changing, and who will be affected?

title.children: The NDIS is changing in WA. What can people expect?

image.altText: Vegetable workers in horticulture farm

props.synopsis: Workplace law breaches are rampant in prime horticulture zones in Victoria and NSW, the ombudsman reports, with labour hire firms the worst culprits and migrant workers most affected.

title.children: Scathing report finds horticulture workers treated 'very badly'

image.altText: A man is tackled during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The Bulldogs have stormed to the top of the ladder by adopting a similar style to Penrith but will it be enough to carry them past the four-time defending premiers on Thursday night?

title.children: Can Penrith's revival take them past a Canterbury made in their image?

image.altText: Christian Gray holds his arms out in celebration while Auckland City FC teammates run towards him

props.synopsis: A goal scored by a PE teacher and assisted by a barber has inspired amateur side Auckland City FC to a famous 1-1 draw against South American giants Boca Juniors at the Club World Cup.

title.children: PE teacher scores as Auckland City records famous World Cup boilover

image.altText: body worn camera footage of robert huber being arrested by police

props.synopsis: Closing arguments have begun in the murder trial of Robert Karl Huber, who is accused of killing his partner, Lindy Lucena, in Ballina in 2023.

title.children: Court told man may have waited three hours before leading police to body

image.altText: A person holds a mobile phone in their hand with the screen open to a digital licence with driver's photograph.

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity specialists warn a "very cheap coding trick" is being spruiked as a high-tech anti-fraud measure on digital drivers licences.

title.children: Digital drivers licence anti-fraud technology only a 'cheap coding trick'

image.altText: Flames out of kitchen ceiling with man pointing to roof

props.synopsis: Two mates on the way to the pub raised the alarm with a "couple of little F-bombs" before helping to stop a fire spreading at a popular Broome Chinese restaurant.

title.children: Mates on way to pub help save historic Chinatown restaurant from fire

image.altText: A crowd of Japanese residents protesting and holding signs

props.synopsis: A court in Japan has sentenced a 22-year-old US marine to seven years in prison for sexually assaulting a woman in Okinawa in May last year. Anti-US base sentiment runs deep due due to multiple crimes committed by US military personnel.

title.children: US marine jailed for seven years for sexual assault in Japan

image.altText: A young couple sit in chairs in a medical clinic as a clinician speaks to them

props.synopsis: Two instances of embryos being transferred into the wrong patient have left people feeling "distressed and unsettled". But experts say there are ways IVF patients can feel more in control.

title.children: Confidence in IVF has taken a hit. How can you feel more in control?

image.altText: Childcare

props.synopsis: It seems without deeper reform the childcare system will continue to bleed public money while failing the children it's meant to serve.

title.children: Damning report reveals childcare subsidy has leaked $2.6b

image.altText: Virgin Australia signs on a window, with ASX boards behind

props.synopsis: Virgin has undergone some radical surgery in the five years since it collapsed, and soared on its ASX re-entry, but the risks of investing in airlines remain.

title.children: Virgin boss dodges a disaster to bring the airline home

image.altText: Brad wears a white and black racing suit, headphones in, as he stands on the track with tens of crew and bystanders behind him.

props.synopsis: What Brad Pitt's F1: The Movie lacks in depth, it makes up for in white-knuckle race sequences.

title.children: Lewis Hamilton produced the F1 movie. So why does it handle race so poorly?
